displaytitle: White-Post and Spandrel, Columbia, California from the "Portfolio VI"
creditline: Gift of Robert S. Rendell, Class of 1962, and Mardi M. Rendell
inscribed:
Inscribed in pencil, recto below lower left corner of image: V1-7 53/110
Signed in pencil, recto below lower right corner of image: Ansel Adams
Stamped in ink, verso center: ANSEL ADAMS/ PORTFOLIO VI/ 1974/ Parasol Press, Ltd. New York/ 7./ WHITE POST AND/ SPANDREL/ Columbia, California, 1953/ All rights reserved. This and other photographs in/ Portfolio VI may not be reproduced in any form/ including Microfile, Microfiche, TV tape, etc.

caption: Ansel Adams (1902–1984; born San Francisco, CA; died Monterey, CA; active San Francisco, CA and Carmel-by-the-Sea, CA), White-Post and Spandrel, Columbia, California from the "Portfolio VI", 1953. Gelatin silver print; 49 x 36 cm (image). Gift of Robert S. Rendell, Class of 1962, and Mardi M. Rendell (2000-425)
